English: The burden of the word of the LORD to Israel by Malachi.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Kră Yang pơma kơ lu bơngai Isơrael đơ̆ng Malachi chih.

English: “I have loved you,” says the LORD. “Yet you say, ‘In what way have You loved us?’ Was not Esau Jacob’s brother?” Says the LORD. “Yet Jacob I have loved
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei khan: “Inh 'mêm kơ lu iĕm;” păng lu iĕm đei khan: “Ih 'mêm kơ lu nhôn thoi yơ?” Kră Yang khan: “Êsâu hăm trŏ kơ 'nhŏng Jakôp dah ưh?

English: But Esau I have hated, And laid waste his mountains and his heritage For the jackals of the wilderness.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh 'mêm kơ Jakôp areh kơ Êsâu, Inh pơm ăn kơ lu bri kông sư jing juơ păng jao mŭk tơmam sư ăn kơ lu kŏ bri tơ lăm char 'blach sa.”

English: Even though Edom has said, “We have been impoverished, But we will return and build the desolate places,” Thus says the LORD of hosts: “They may build, but I will throw down; They shall be called the Territory of Wickedness, And the people against whom the LORD will have indignation forever.
Bahnar: Tơdah bơngai Eđôm khan thoi âu: “Lu bơ̆n đe pơrăm đĭ boih, mă-lei lu bơ̆n gô brŏk pơjing dơ̆ng dôm lu anih đêl đe pơrăm,” thoi noh Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Lu sư gô pơdơ̆ng ming, mă-lei Inh gô tơlơ̆ lê̆, dĭng mah đe krao anăn lu sư dêh char kơnê̆ păng jing kon pơlei pơla mă Kră Yang hil areh ling-lang.”

English: Your eyes shall see, And you shall say, ‘The LORD is magnified beyond the border of Israel.’
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô 'bôh tơm măt păng lu iĕm gô khan thoi âu: “Ư-ang kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh mơ̆n 'nguaih kơ lăm Isơrael!”

English: “A son honors his father, And a servant his master. If then I am the Father, Where is My honor? And if I am a Master, Where is My reverence? Says the LORD of hosts To you priests who despise My name. Yet you say, ‘In what way have we despised Your name?’
Bahnar: “Kon drŏ-nglo kơkuh pơyom kơ 'bă sư, đĭch đam hli yom kơ yŏng tơ'ngla sư. Thoi noh tơdah Inh jing 'Bă iĕm, lei tơdrong lu iĕm kơkuh pơyom kơ Inh? Păng tơdah Inh jing yŏng tơ'ngla, lei lu sư hli yom kơ Inh tơ yơ?” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan kơ lu sư thoi noh. “Ơ lu 'bok soi pơdê anăn Inh!” Lu iĕm đei khan: “Tơ yơ nhôn đei pơdê anăn Ih?”

English: “You offer defiled food on My altar, But say, ‘In what way have we defiled You?’ By saying, ‘The table of the LORD is contemptible.’
Bahnar: “Lu iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam 'mê̆-'mach tơ gơ'bang soi Inh, đơ̆ng noh lu iĕm khan: ‘Lu nhôn pơm kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach kơ Ih tơ yơ?’ Noh mă tơdrong lu sư khan: ‘Gơ'bang Kră Yang trŏ kơ pơdê.’

English: And when you offer the blind as a sacrifice, Is it not evil? And when you offer the lame and sick, Is it not evil? Offer it then to your governor! Would he be pleased with you? Would he accept you favorably?” Says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi păng sem dơrong măt tol, tơdrong noh ưh kơ trŏ krưp dêh tơpă hă? Kơplah iĕm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi hăm sem dơrong jơ̆ng jo dah jĭ, tơdrong ưh kơ trŏ krưp dêh hă? Lu iĕm pơlong pơyơ̆r lăng kơ yŏng tơ'ngla iĕm thoi noh lăng sư hăm lăp đon kơ iĕm ưh?” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “But now entreat God’s favor, That He may be gracious to us. While this is being done by your hands, Will He accept you favorably?” Says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: “Lu iĕm đei pơm boih tơdrong noh, liơ Sư sơng iŏk minh 'nu lăm lu iĕm? 'Nâu dang ei Inh athei iĕm apinh bĕ tơdrong mơnat đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, wă kơ Sư mơnat ăn,” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “Who is there even among you who would shut the doors, So that you would not kindle fire on My altar in vain? I have no pleasure in you,” Says the LORD of hosts, “Nor will I accept an offering from your hands.
Bahnar: “Hơpơi rŏ kơ đei minh 'nu lăm lu iĕm tang 'măng, wă kơ lu iĕm huay tơ̆k ŭnh tơdrong kơđei tơ kơpal gơ'bang soi Inh,” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh. “Inh ưh kơ đei jơhngơ̆m hiôk lăp đon kơ lu iĕm păng Inh ưh kơ wă đei iŏk minh tơmam soi pơyơ̆r kiơ đơ̆ng ti lu iĕm.

English: For from the rising of the sun, even to its going down, My name shall be great among the Gentiles; In every place incense shall be offered to My name, And a pure offering; For My name shall be great among the nations,” Says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Iŏk đơ̆ng măt 'năr lĕch truh tơ măt 'năr mơ̆t, yua kơ anăn Inh jing tih tơpă tơ lăm adrĕch adrung kon bơngai. Tơ lăm jơ̆p-jang anih, đe gô pơyơ̆r 'long 'bâu phu păng tơmam soi 'lơ̆ng rơgoh kơ anăn Inh; yua kơ anăn Inh gô jing tih tơpă tơ lăm adrĕch adrung nai.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “But you profane it, In that you say, ‘The table of the LORD is defiled; And its fruit, its food, is contemptible.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm pơma kơnê̆ 'mê̆ brư̆ kơ anăn Inh boih khan: “Gơ'bang soi Kră Yang 'mê̆-'mach, tơmam soi kơpal gơ'bang noh trŏ kơ pơjăm.”

English: You also say, ‘Oh, what a weariness!’ And you sneer at it,” Says the LORD of hosts. “And you bring the stolen, the lame, and the sick; Thus you bring an offering! Should I accept this from your hand?” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm đei khan dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Ô! Tơdrong jang gleh dêh pă băt dang yơ! Na lu iĕm pơdê sư.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh. “Lu iĕm năm pơyơ̆r tơmam đơ̆ng iĕm tơtông păng lu kon sem dơrong jo, jĭ na mă năm pơyơ̆r kơ Inh. Inh hăm đei iŏk tơmam âu đơ̆ng ti lu iĕm ưh?” Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “But cursed be the deceiver Who has in his flock a male, And takes a vow, But sacrifices to the Lord what is blemished— For I am a great King,” Says the LORD of hosts, “And My name is to be feared among the nations.
Bahnar: “Lu bơngai hơlĕnh noh trŏ kơ hil mĭl păng hiap tơpă, lăm khŭl sem dơrong noh đei kon tơno 'lơ̆ng, mă-lei lu sư pơkă wă pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang na iŏk kon sem jo jăn pơm tơmam soi. Yua kơ Inh Pơtao tih, anăn Inh trŏ kơ hli yom tơ lăm đĭ adrĕch adrung kon bơngai.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “And now, O priests, this commandment is for you.
Bahnar: “Ơ lu 'bok soi, dang ei Inh tơtă ăn tơdrong âu kơ lu iĕm.

English: If you will not hear, And if you will not take it to heart, To give glory to My name,” Says the LORD of hosts, “I will send a curse upon you, And I will curse your blessings. Yes, I have cursed them already, Because you do not take it to heart.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm ưh kơ mơ̆ng, tơdah iĕm ưh kơ đei răk lăm jơhngơ̆m ư-ang kơ anăn Inh,” lei Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Inh gô tơjur tơdrong hiap pơtê̆ tơ kơpal lu iĕm păng Inh gô hiap pơtê̆ lu tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rŏ lu iĕm; păng Inh gô hiap boih, yua kơ lu iĕm ưh kơ đei răk lăm jơhngơ̆m iĕm.

English: “Behold, I will rebuke your descendants And spread refuse on your faces, The refuse of your solemn feasts; And one will take you away with it.
Bahnar: Tơpă, Inh gô chrih kơ adrĕch lu iĕm rei, kon sâu iĕm păng Inh gô săi 'mê̆ tơ muh măt lu iĕm, wă khan 'mê̆ đơ̆ng ĭch đơ̆ng sem dơrong lu iĕm pơyơ̆r; na Inh gô puh tơweh lu iĕm đơ̆ng anăp Inh.

English: Then you shall know that I have sent this commandment to you, That My covenant with Levi may continue,” Says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm băt boih nơ̆r Inh âu khan kơ lu iĕm, wă kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p Inh hăm Lêwi.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “My covenant was with him, one of life and peace, And I gave them to him that he might fear Me; So he feared Me And was reverent before My name.
Bahnar: “Nơ̆r pơgơ̆p Inh hăm bơngai Lêwi oei ling-lang, tơdrong arih păng tơdrong rơnŭk rơnua mă Inh đei ăn boih kơ lu sư, wă kơ lu sư hli yom kơ Inh, thoi noh lu sư hli yom kơ Inh boih păng tơtơ̆ 'bơ̆t anăp anăn Inh.

English: The law of truth was in his mouth, And injustice was not found on his lips. He walked with Me in peace and equity, And turned many away from iniquity.
Bahnar: Tơdrong khôi juăt tơdrong tơpăt oei boih tơ lăm 'bơ̆r lu sư bơtho, lăm hơkŭng lu sư ưh pă đei tơdrong kơnê̆ boih; lu sư yak hơdai hăm Inh lăm tơdrong hiôk-hian păng tơpăt, pơm ăn kơ lơ bơngai weh achăng đơ̆ng tơdrong kơnê̆.

English: “For the lips of a priest should keep knowledge, And people should seek the law from his mouth; For he is the messenger of the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Yua kơ hơkŭng 'bơ̆r 'bok soi athei wei tơdrong hlôh wao, lu đe chă tơdrong juăt đơ̆ng lăm 'bơ̆r lu sư, yua kơ lu sư jơ̆ bơngai đơ̆ng Kră Yang Tih Hloh.

English: But you have departed from the way; You have caused many to stumble at the law. You have corrupted the covenant of Levi,” Says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, tơplơ̆ dơ̆ng, lu iĕm rok trong nai, pơm kơ lơ bơngai pơm glăi kơ khôi juăt păng lu iĕm pơm glăi boih kơ nơ̆r Inh pơgơ̆p hăm Lêwi.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “Therefore I also have made you contemptible and base Before all the people, Because you have not kept My ways But have shown partiality in the law.”
Bahnar: “Yua kơ thoi noh na Inh kư̆m đei pơm ăn kơ lu iĕm rai iĕ jing pă rơ-a 'bơ̆t anăp đĭ kon pơlei pơla, yua kơ lu iĕm ưh kơ kiơ̆ trong Inh pơdah kơ đe khan lu iĕm oei lăm khôi juăt.”

English: Have we not all one Father? Has not one God created us? Why do we deal treacherously with one another By profaning the covenant of the fathers?
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơ̆n ưh kơ trŏ minh pôm 'bă hă? Hăm trŏ lăp minh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch mă pơjing lu bơ̆n? Thoi ei boih liơ mă bơ̆n pơm ưh kơ tơpăt chă hơlĕnh băl tơduă lu bơ̆n, pơm glăi kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p 'bok yă bơ̆n?

English: Judah has dealt treacherously, And an abomination has been committed in Israel and in Jerusalem, For Judah has profaned The LORD’s holy institution which He loves: He has married the daughter of a foreign god.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđa oei sa ưh kơ tơpăt hơlĕnh pơdăr păng đei pơm minh tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ tih krưp tơpă lăm lu bơngai Isơrael păng lăm pơlei Jêrusalem; Juđa đei pơm boih tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Kră Yang, yua kơ lu sư iŏk oei kơ drŏ-kăn yang tơmoi.

English: May the LORD cut off from the tents of Jacob The man who does this, being awake and aware, Yet who brings an offering to the LORD of hosts!
Bahnar: Mă lu bơngai đei pơm tơdrong noh, mă lu bơngai oei hơđơ̆r, dah lu bơngai drơ̆ng nơ̆r, dah lu bơngai pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Kră Yang gô chơ̆ng hŭt lê̆ lu sư đơ̆ng hnam Jakôp.

English: And this is the second thing you do: You cover the altar of the LORD with tears, With weeping and crying; So He does not regard the offering anymore, Nor receive it with goodwill from your hands.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm kư̆m oei pơm tơdrong âu: Lu iĕm nhơ̆m hmoi, hơdrĭ hơdrôi, đak măt lĕch gom lê̆ gơ'bang soi Kră Yang, Sư ưh pă iŏk boih tơmam soi lu iĕm păng kư̆m ưh pă lăp đon iŏk tơmam pơyơ̆r đơ̆ng ti lu iĕm.

English: Yet you say, “For what reason?” Because the LORD has been witness Between you and the wife of your youth, With whom you have dealt treacherously; Yet she is your companion And your wife by covenant.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm đei khan: “Yua kơ kiơ?” Yua kơ Kră Yang băt kơ măr iĕm ih hăm akăn ih mă iŏk oei đơ̆ng 'lơ̆p sơ̆, bơngai mă oei hơdai ih păng jing akăn ih đei pơgơ̆p hăm ih boih. Mă-lei ih kư̆m oei sa hơbĕch pơdăr hăm sư 'mơ̆i.

English: But did He not make them one, Having a remnant of the Spirit? And why one? He seeks godly offspring. Therefore take heed to your spirit, And let none deal treacherously with the wife of his youth.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, mă khan tơdrong arih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei lơ rơkah rơkai ră, mă-lei Sư pơjing ăn kơ ih lăp minh 'nu drŏ-kăn đĕch. Mă-lei yua kơ kiơ Sư pơjing ăn kơ ih lăp minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn đĕch? Noh yua kơ wă chă adrĕch adrung 'lơ̆ng rơgoh, thoi noh lu iĕm athei mă kơchăng lăm jơhngơ̆m bơ̆n kơdih, 'nĕ kơ oei sa hơlĕnh pơdăr hăm akăn bơ̆n kơdih mă iŏk oei đơ̆ng 'lơ̆p.

English: “For the LORD God of Israel says That He hates divorce, For it covers one’s garment with violence,” Says the LORD of hosts. “Therefore take heed to your spirit, That you do not deal treacherously.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael đei khan boih thoi âu: “Inh areh dêh kơ bơngai bu mă hrĕch achăng akăn păng bơngai bu mă gom lê̆ sư kơdih hăm tơdrong khĕnh hơwĕng thoi bơngai mă gom lê̆ akâu sư hăm hơbĕn ao sư.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh: Thoi noh athei wei bĕ jơhngơ̆m lu iĕm kơdih, 'nĕ pă chă hơlĕnh pơdăr băl.

English: You have wearied the LORD with your words; Yet you say, “In what way have we wearied Him?” In that you say, “Everyone who does evil Is good in the sight of the LORD, And He delights in them,” Or, “Where is the God of justice?”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm đei pơm kơ Kră Yang blĕk dêh, đơ̆ng nơ̆r iĕm pơma; khan dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Tơ yơ lu nhôn đei pơm kơ Sư blĕk.” Noh 'bơ̆t iĕm khan: “Bơngai bu pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ noh Kră Yang lăp đon păng Sư kư̆m lăp đon kơ lu bơngai thoi noh;” mưh khan thoi ei lei, “lei tơ yơ khan Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơpăt?”

English: “Behold, I send My messenger, And he will prepare the way before Me. And the Lord, whom you seek, Will suddenly come to His temple, Even the Messenger of the covenant, In whom you delight. Behold, He is coming,” Says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: “'Nâu, Inh đei wơh bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Inh, sư gô pơih trong adrol kơ Inh; păng Kră Yang mă lu iĕm chơchă Sư gô blư truh mơ̆t tơ lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei, wă khan linh jang khan nơ̆r Sư pơgơ̆p hăm iĕm mă lu iĕm oei chang gô. 'Nâu, Sư truh!” Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “But who can endure the day of His coming? And who can stand when He appears? For He is like a refiner’s fire And like launderers’ soap.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'bơ̆t năr Kră Yang truh bu kĕ dơ̆ng? Păng bơngai bu kĕ dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t năr tơ'bơ̆p Sư? Yua kơ Sư thoi pla ŭnh lu bơngai thơ̆ hơjơ̆m, thoi gơmơ̆k đak 'bŏng lu bơngai pih.

English: He will sit as a refiner and a purifier of silver; He will purify the sons of Levi, And purge them as gold and silver, That they may offer to the LORD An offering in righteousness.
Bahnar: Sư gô hơ-oei thoi lu bơngai jôr hu pơm rơgoh đĭ, sư gô chhut lu kon drŏ-nglo Lêwi, pơm ăn kơ lu sư rơgoh thoi maih păng hu, lu sư gô pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang lăm tơdrong tơpăt.

English: “Then the offering of Judah and Jerusalem Will be pleasant to the LORD, As in the days of old, As in former years.
Bahnar: Dang ei tơmam soi đơ̆ng bơngai Juđa hăm pơlei Jêrusalem gô gơh pơm ăn jơhngơ̆m Kră Yang lăp đon, kư̆m thoi lu ki sơ̆ păng thoi lu sơnăm chăl kră sơ̆.

English: And I will come near you for judgment; I will be a swift witness Against sorcerers, Against adulterers, Against perjurers, Against those who exploit wage earners and widows and orphans, And against those who turn away an alien— Because they do not fear Me,” Says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: “Inh gô năm jê̆ lu iĕm wă kơ sek tơlang păng Inh gô pơm tơ'bôh wă blơ̆ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, lu bơngai pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, lu bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr, lu bơngai pơgâm sa jên lu bơngai jang mưng, pơjuă lu bơngai hơdro-po păng lu bơngai mơti, lu bơngai mă pơrăm lu bơngai tơmoi păng lu bơngai mă kuă kơkuh păng hli yom kơ Inh,” mă Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “For I am the LORD, I do not change; Therefore you are not consumed, O sons of Jacob.
Bahnar: “Yua kơ Inh jơ̆ Kră Yang, Inh ưh kơ đei layơ tơplih, yua kơ thoi noh, lu iĕm jơ̆ kon drŏ-nglo Jakôp, huay kơ lôch hiong.

English: Yet from the days of your fathers You have gone away from My ordinances And have not kept them. Return to Me, and I will return to you,” Says the LORD of hosts. “But you said, ‘In what way shall we return?’
Bahnar: Iŏk đơ̆ng năr lu 'bok yă iĕm, lu iĕm ưh pă chu yom wei răk păng achăng khôi juăt Inh. Wih tơ Inh bĕ, na Inh kư̆m gô wih tơ lu iĕm,” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh. Mă-lei lu iĕm khan: “Lu nhôn gô wih liơ?

English: “Will a man rob God? Yet you have robbed Me! But you say, ‘In what way have we robbed You?’ In tithes and offerings.
Bahnar: Kon bơngai gơh tơtông iŏk Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hă? Na iĕm tơtông Inh. Lu iĕm khan: ‘Tơ yơ khan lu nhôn tơtông Ih?’ Lu iĕm đei tơtông boih minh lăm mơjĭt đơ̆ng lăm lu tơmam iĕm pơyơ̆r.

English: You are cursed with a curse, For you have robbed Me, Even this whole nation.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm păng đĭ-đăng teh đak đei pŭ hơngiap, yua kơ đơ̆ng lu iĕm tơtông boih đơ̆ng Inh.

English: Bring all the tithes into the storehouse, That there may be food in My house, And try Me now in this,” Says the LORD of hosts, “If I will not open for you the windows of heaven And pour out for you such blessing That there will not be room enough to receive it.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm athei pơyơ̆r iŏk minh lăm mơjĭt tah tơ lăm pơk Inh, wă kơ đei tơmam sa lăm hnam Inh; păng đơ̆ng năr âu lu iĕm athei pơlong lăng Inh, Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan, lăng Inh hăm pơih lu 'măng-'mŏk tơ kơpal plĕnh ti tuh ăn tơdrong pŭn hiôk kơ lu iĕm dĭng truh anih mong pă đei!

English: “And I will rebuke the devourer for your sakes, So that he will not destroy the fruit of your ground, Nor shall the vine fail to bear fruit for you in the field,” Says the LORD of hosts
Bahnar: Inh gô găn lu hơdrông kơnu wă kơ lu sư huay kăp kuer sa pơkao plei 'long đơ̆ng teh iĕm; păng lu tơm 'long hơmu lăm mir pơgar plei pơkao sư huay kơ hơlŭng adrol kơ bơyan sư, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “And all nations will call you blessed, For you will be a delightful land,” Says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Jơ̆p kơ teh đak đe gô ư-ang kơ lu iĕm đei pŭn hiôk, yua kơ đơ̆ng iĕm na teh gô chơt hiôk.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “Your words have been harsh against Me,” Says the LORD, “Yet you say, ‘What have we spoken against You?’
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: “Lu iĕm iŏk nơ̆r pơrŏ wă blah Inh.” Mă-lei lu iĕm khan: “Lu nhôn đei pơma kiơ khan wă blah Kră Yang?”

English: You have said, ‘It is useless to serve God; What profit is it that we have kept His ordinance, And that we have walked as mourners Before the LORD of hosts?
Bahnar: Lu iĕm đei khan: “Đe mă bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei noh tơdrong ưh kơ đei; lu bơ̆n wei nơ̆r Sư bơtho pơkă, athei bơwei păng yak nơnăm lăm tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang Tih Hloh, na lơi kiơ?

English: So now we call the proud blessed, For those who do wickedness are raised up; They even tempt God and go free.’ ”
Bahnar: Âu lu bơ̆n jô̆ lu bơngai pơrŏ pơang đei pŭn hiôk, lu sư pơm tơdrong kơnê̆ tă kơ rai tŏk. Lu sư pơlong Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng đei klaih hlôi boih!”

English: Then those who feared the LORD spoke to one another, And the LORD listened and heard them; So a book of remembrance was written before Him For those who fear the LORD And who meditate on His name.
Bahnar: Dang ei lu bơngai hli yom kơ Kră Yang pơma tơduă lu sư thoi noh Kră Yang kơtơ̆ng păng mơ̆ng; păng sơ̆p hla bơar đei chih 'bơ̆t anăp Sư wă kơ tơ'blŏk ăn kơ lu bơngai mă hli yom kơ Kră Yang păng 'blŏk kơ anăn Sư.

English: “They shall be Mine,” says the LORD of hosts, “On the day that I make them My jewels. And I will spare them As a man spares his own son who serves him.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Lu bơngai noh lu sư jing gah Inh, jing tơmam 'măn kơ Inh yua lăm năr Inh wă pơm. Inh gô mơnat ăn kơ lu sư thoi 'bă mơnat ăn kơ kon tơdăm sư bơ̆jang kơ sư kơdih.

English: Then you shall again discern Between the righteous and the wicked, Between one who serves God And one who does not serve Him.
Bahnar: Dang ei lu iĕm gô wih brŏk păng Inh klah lu bơngai tơpăt hăm lu bơngai pơm yoch kơnê̆ pha; lu bơngai bơ̆jang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm lu bơngai ưh kơ bơ̆jang kơ Sư pha.”

English: “For behold, the day is coming, Burning like an oven, And all the proud, yes, all who do wickedly will be stubble. And the day which is coming shall burn them up,” Says the LORD of hosts, “That will leave them neither root nor branch.
Bahnar: “Yua kơ âu, năr truh thoi ŭnh sa khơ̆ng lăm tơnuh đe tơkuh. Dôm lu bơngai pơang, lu bơngai pơm yoch kơnê̆ lu sư nhen thoi hơnong 'ba, 'nhĕt kro;” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: “Truh năr ei kơnh, Inh gô soh pơđĭ lu sư, ưh pă lê̆ mă dơng mă rơh.

English: But to you who fear My name The Sun of Righteousness shall arise With healing in His wings; And you shall go out And grow fat like stall-fed calves.
Bahnar: Mă-lei gah lu iĕm, lu bơngai hli yom kơ anăn Inh, thoi noh măt 'năr tơdrong tơpăt gô pơchrang ăn, lăm năr noh kơnh gô đei pơklaih tơdrong jĭ jăn; lu iĕm gô lĕch pơplŏng thoi rơmo dăm lĕch đơ̆ng lăm hơdrong.

English: You shall trample the wicked, For they shall be ashes under the soles of your feet On the day that I do this,” Says the LORD of hosts.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô pơjuă gơhlơ̆r lê̆ lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, yua kơ lăm năr mă Inh pơm noh, lu sư nhen thoi rơnok tơ ala jơ̆ng lu iĕm.” Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan thoi noh.

English: “Remember the Law of Moses, My servant, Which I commanded him in Horeb for all Israel, With the statutes and judgments.
Bahnar: “Lei lu iĕm athei 'blŏk bĕ kơ khôi juăt Môis, đĭch đam Inh, mă Inh khan tơbăt ăn kơ sư tơ kông Hôrêp, wă khan dôm tơdrong juăt păng nơ̆r tơtă ăn kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael.

English: Behold, I will send you Elijah the prophet Before the coming of the great and dreadful day of the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Nâu Inh gô wơh 'bok khan lê̆ adrol anăn sư Êli gô truh tơ lu iĕm adrol kơ năr tih krưp wă truh trŏ kơ năr hli tơpă đơ̆ng Kră Yang.

English: And he will turn The hearts of the fathers to the children, And the hearts of the children to their fathers, Lest I come and strike the earth with a curse.”
Bahnar: Sư gô pơm ăn kơ jơhngơ̆m 'bă hơlơ̆k 'blŏk kơ kon sâu sư, kon sâu sư gô hơlơ̆k 'blŏk kơ 'bă lu sư, hli kơnh Inh wă pơrăm teh âu hăm tơdrong hiap.”
